Ratings.comment: He is a very knowledgeable and approachable professor. This class has 1 midterm, 1 final, and 1 paper. There's no homework but you need to read assigned texts before class and participate in class discussions. Participation is important. He is a fair grader, so you'll get a decent grade as long as you put some effort in this class.

Great professor, really knows his field look at the excellence of his publications..., approachable, cares about his students. He contextualize literature in the political context of that time and I am personally not very interested in the political aspect in such great details.

The professor knows the material and really pushes the students to think critically about the films.  Show up, participate a little, and use proper grammar on your essays and you will get an A.  The only negative: for a class that deals so heavily with identity politics some of his approaches are problematic.

This class was the easiest class I have taken at OSU so far.  If you want an A, then just show up to every class, watch the movie, give your opinion, and when you have to write a paper, put a little effort in to it, making sure you have good grammar usage.  Prof. Denton seemed like a nice guy, very liberal, but still open to opposing views.

This class is very straight forward. Denton is extremely opinionated and can get on your nerves, but gives you everything you need to know for the tests (which are short answer). You can get the main book from a public library and you don't need all of the other books.
Kind of uptight, unpleasant and sometimes condescending in one-on-one situations.. And class sure can drag sometimes.

This class was interesting if only because we got to see all kinds of Chinese film that's hard to come by otherwise. There wasn't a lot of homework, but attendance was important (if you didn't come, you probably wouldn't understand the films, anyway). Overall, I enjoyed it.
He really knew the material, carried good class conversations, a nice guy.
His class = naptime. Is more like a history class than a lit class. Reading assignments are light and exams are not difficult though.
his class is a bore.

To get an A, must go to every class.  He gives A's to people he sees every class.  Subject material is harder for non-native chinese but make sure you still go even if you just lived in china.  Take notes in class, thats all that is tested on the exam.  Great class!
Class isn't too hard. Although he is one teacher who says that participation counts for the grade, and actually takes note of it. Seems interested in teaching, but often boring.

He turned a previously graded A+ paper and after following all his advice gave me a C- for the entire class. I have talked to other professors who all agreed that should not have happened. He is by far the worst professor at OSU. Made me give up academics. Extremely pompous and arrogant and otherwise unpleasant to be around.

The class was enjoyable and applicable to people of all fields of study! There was a good variety of fiction, nonfiction, and film which really made the concepts discussed come full circle. Films were watched and discussed in class and were great bases for the papers written. Participation is essential to the class but also very helpful to you!

This class was a good surprise for me as I was not at all into the subject! 3 essay exams that if (I think) you put effort into them, you'll get decent grades. He's not out to trick students; very fair & on the easygoing side. Go to class b/c participation is important & discussion is valuable! Lots of reading but not too difficult, & it pays off.
Avoid at all costs. Unclear on goals and grading system. Poor communication and unapproachable. Unmotivational. I would never recommend.

Dr. Holland is extremely intelligent and knowscares a lot about what he is teaching. Assigned readings were difficult, and he attempted to make them clearer but oftentimes had difficulty communicating his thoughts clearly and helping the conversation go in a productive direction. Easy grader, no tests
Awesome class! Eugene really knew how to engage the students. I actually enjoyed going to class everyday. He is very helpful and funny.

He's a nice guy, but unless you are really into french history, you won't enjoy this class. He lectures the entire time. He speaks very well for not being a native speaker. Most people get As and Bs on his exams but you definitely have to study for them (they're completely essay). Class isn't impossible, but isn't easy either.

There are ways of making history class fun and interesting. This guy knows none of these. Make sure your french is good before taking this class because he talks the entire hour and 48 minutes without stopping.
okay
He has unclear/vague writing promts some of the time. His class was challenging yet fair. He does have a good sense of humor, but make sure the class takes up the full hour and 48 minutes.

I had to drop his class because he makes you read too much.  He seems like a nice guy, but I just never understood what he wanted from his students.  I'm not saying you shouldn't take him, but I did think he was hard.
Great professor! He works hard to make sure you succeed in his course.

This was one of the most frustrating classes I have ever taken. Absolutely zero organization and awfully boring/tedious lectures. Impossible to get ahold of and randomly canceled class. Ultra specific quizzes that were impossible to study for. Took the entire last half of the semester to grade the midterm. Sweet old guy but should NOT be teaching.

Professor Graf is a nice guy, but if you don't like long lectures I do not recommend this class. His lectures last the entire class (and sometimes over). That being said, if you are really passionate about Roman religion and want to learn more, take this class! He also grades heavily on about 4-5 quizzes, a midterm, and a final exam.

Lectures are boring and all over the place - hard to follow/can't participate. Slides are confusing and include many typos. Can't learn material. Not communicative about schedule/things in general. Only grades you will receive in this class are from quizzes and 2 essays that are worth 30% of your grade EACH. Nice guy, but difficult to understand.

Bunch of quizzes made up 10%, then a paper was 40% and the final was 50%. Super nice guy who clearly loves what he teaches, but it was very scary to have so much of the grade on a paper he barely talked about/that there wasn't even a rubric for. Classes were super boring with no participation, if he asked questions and discussed it'd be way better

The course was fascinating but poorly structured. It could have been a little better put together in terms of grouping topics; possibly into units. The lectures were fun and very interesting, but beware that the readings were very necessary in order to understand the lectures. Fun if you are willing to put the work in.
very unclear about schedule and due dates. Extremely specific quizzes and unnecessary PowerPoint slides.

Fritz is the bomb, very enthusiastic lecturer and clearly loves what he does. His accent can take a while to get used to, but he is very open about having you ask questions if you didn't understand what he said. 1010, would recommend him.

He is the man! He's so nice and extremely fair. My class was about the Greek gods and we just had to have readings done which weren't that bad at all. The books were interesting, there were a lot of books but I only spent $100, and you could even get away without reading if you don't want to although I recommend it. Overall is exactly what you want

I pulled out close to 100% in this class.  Go to class, do the readings, and you can easily get an A.  Minimum effort required, no homework at all, just the weekly quizzes.  If you do the reading and listen to what he says, it should be cake.
He is not bad at all.  If you go to class and take notes, you should get an easy A.  The quiz questions were embarassingly easy sometimes

This class was unusually difficult, I had a friend who took H222 and it was easier than this class. The weekly quizzes are very hard, he asks very specific non-important things. His teaching style is not very helpful in learning the material. I would not recommend this course to anyone.

Contrary to what everyone else has said, it is entirely possible to get an A in this class. I have one. All you have to do is got to the lectures, read the readings, and go over the notes for an hour or two before the quiz. Definantly NOT impossible. This is a very interesing class and I highly recommend taking it.

His powerpoint slides seem like they were made by a ten year old. Nothing seems to be very organized in this class. Most times his lectures and the readings barely overlap, so you've got a****load of information to know for each week's 25 question quiz. He also says there will be no curve but I bet few people will get A's if he doesn't.
Good lecturer, nice guy. Thick accent though, I missed things that he said here and there. This is a very interesting class.
Easy class, Easy Grader.  Once you get past his European accent you'll understand everything.  Highly recommended for those with Liturature GECs!
he sucks

Weekly readings, 3 required books (PDF versions easily found online), and a final paper. The reading sheet assignments were tedious and not very helpful for understanding but proved whether or not the student read the material. Just prove you did the bare minimum and you'll pass. Easy to access by email and was very lax on hard deadlines.

She made the class really engaging and allowed everyone to speak their minds. The first day/syllabus were pretty scary and she seemed a lot stricter than she really was. She really wants to help her students succeed not only in her class but also in their everyday lives. I highly recommend taking her class, but there are a TON of little assignments
I wen to this class twice and just studied the night before and got an A-. he posts everything online, really nice professor class isnt that boring. if you go to class he give bonus quizes.

Great guy!  No textbook.  Tests are straight forward -- he wants students to succeed.  Simply look over the notes on Carmen and you'll do great.  Also attending class helps make the info stick, as he gives many examples.  Also, if you are in Business, I recommend taking this class along with your CS&E 200.
Extremely nice guy.  Test were not too bad.....gives extra credit sometimes if you come to class.  Did not put much effort into class at all and got a B
Great professor! No textbook or homework. Test are easy and straight foward. Just study notes he post on Carmen and you'll be good to go.

Really great teacher. Put up slides on Carmen and there wasn't much need to attend class although he did give out random extra credit for those who were there. No need to attend class regularly to get a B.
This teacher is amazing. He is EXTREMELY nice and treats the class like a 200 level. The exams are very easy and he is very interesting and you can tell he loves his job and his students.

such an incredibly nice, older, laid back guy. i seriously NEVER went to class and half of the class never showed up either except on exam days. actually does have good lectures though because he covers material that is useful and interesting. i would recommend his class any day. all you have to do is study the slides for his tests.
Easy. You don't have to attend class to get an easy B+!!!

awesome guy. he didn't try to rail you on the tests he actually tries to teach you stuff that applies in real life. the test are actually easy if you study at all and I probably learned more from him than most other profs Ive had

pretty easy class if you go to lecture, print out the notes before-hand and you just fill in the blanks from his powerpoint slides. study those for the tests and you should get at least a B easily, makes class pretty interesting also, one of the best profs i've had in 3 years at ohio state
one of the best at ohio state. he is easy but you will learn and want to go to class. one of my favorites.

He's a really nice guy and it's an extremely easy class.  Make sure you read the articles online and read your notes before the exams that will help you out a lot.  He doesn't like the class average to be less than a B so expect a curve if that's the case.
Not what I expected. In a good way.
Funny, laid back, eager to help students understand
Bodybuilding films and diet books the main topics of discussion.
No Comments

Class is awesome. We studied diet and exercise literature (by Arnold Schwarzenegger) and wrote papers analyzing it. Class was fun, papers weren't hard, and he would tell you what to fix on them for an A in office hours.
No Comments

Reff's a great guy. I've had him for two different GECs. His feedback on essays are insightful and he openly gives tips during quizzes. In class, he makes an effort to include everyone in discussions. Quizzes and essays are tedious and hard at first but most people seem to get the hang of it after one or two.  I really can't recommend him enough.

Great professor and even better person. Read a lot of really interesting pieces of literature in this course. No exams, grade consists of attendance and quizzes based on the books. Quizzes are easy if you take the time to read.
This class requires a lot of reading and attention to detail but there is no finals, or midterms so your grade is based purely on in class quizzes and attendance.

Twice as much writing (8 four page papers) than I had to do for my writing class, and lots of reading but it was really interesting. Class is discussion-based, but the discussion was relaxed. He goes off on tangents sometimes, but I recommend the class and professor.

Prof Reff is a good teacher. Class discussion was interesting and laid back. Attendance isnt mandatory per say but its important, and classroom participation is crucial. NO EXAMS but a 200pg book and 4 page paper on it basically every week.

Loved this class. Reff's a very funny and laid-back guy. Participation is worth 25% of the grade, so go to class. Other than that, you read the book, take a fill-in-the-blank quiz on it, and that's it. No midterm or final. Almost all of the readings were really good. I definitely recommend this class.
Very nice, friendly guy. The readings and class discussions were interesting and stimulating, most of the time. Quizzes are easy if you do the readings. Class attendance and participation are graded.

Overall a pretty good professor.  He's really nice and class discussions were okay.  There was a lot of required reading and papers so don't take it if you have a busy schedule.  Unfortunately I did but I still got an A.

I liked a lot of the reading, but class discussions were flat, never insightful. I was so excited for this class and I don't feel like I learned anything new or mind blowing. The quiz-only grade structure would is okay, but beware: the quizzes were always subjective and sometimes inaccurate. An easy class, if that's your thing.

Some of the readings didn't do justice to the topics or were just plain boring.  Four word bank quizzes and four short papers, all of which were cake if you did the readings.  He's easy to get along with and completely reasonable, which isn't always a given.

Professor Reff was a likeable guy, but I can't approve of the way he taught the class.  The readings were mostly awful.  The class focused almost exclusively on the plight of minorities, women, and gays.  American culture involves a little more than that!  This isn't a criticism of the class, but there was a lot of writing.  This isn't an easy A.
Pretty easy class.  7 papers and NO midterm or final!  30% class participation...grades rather subjectively, but is a pretty good teacher.  A lot of reading though.
He is an excellent teacher.  He really makes you think on your own and will continue to push you to think for yourself.  It is alot of work for his class, but very enjoyable.
Pretty good instructor, though sometimes goes overboard with telling you his own opinions.  Good with class discussions though.
Reff is cool, smart and a fair grader.  He's also not into his own B.S. like a lot of profs.  He cares about students first.
One of my favorite profs.
Mike is such a great lecturer. He knows exactly what he's talking about and really wants to get his students involved in discussions. I HIGHLY recommend.
great!

He is one of the best teachers I've ever had. You can tell he cares about his students. Feedback given on papers was very helpful making me a better, more organized writer. Though some of the content wasn't fun,it was still taught in a way that made it interesting and I learned a lot. He clearly wants all to succeed and it is refreshing.
Professor McVicar was excellent at keeping the class engaged. His assignments were fair and not too difficult. He was always available if someone asked a question or needed help in general.

McVicar is a great teacher. He's very laid back but you have to do the reading and participate in class. The class is very comfortable, so speaking up is pretty easy. He really knows his stuff and is interested and teaching the class. Oh, and he's fun to watch, as previously stated: highly attractive

Incredibly helpful and easy-going, as long as you play by his rules. Do the work, read, speak up in class, and you're assured a good grade. Willing to make exceptions if you give him a good enough reason within decent time. Also, as mentioned by most others, he is very good looking.
Awesome, great guy. He's ridiculously intellegent and makes class interesting and fun. Keep up with the readings, ask a lot of questions, speak up in class, and ask for help if you need it!

I was already interested in the subject before taking the class, but now I love it even more. He's really knowledgeable about religion, and his lectures are fun and informative. It's not too demanding of a class, and I definitely recommend it. It's one of my favorite classes at OSU.

He is a very helpful and kind mentor. I thought, at first, that the course was going to be boring; however, I ended up looking forward to class. My friend and I decided to sit towards the front on the first day. Then he walked in. How lucky we were!

He is a very kind and helpful mentor. The class, at first, didn't seem like it was going to be interesting; however, now I look forward to it. My friend and I decided to sit towards the front on the first day. Then he walked in. How lucky we were! :)
Dope teacher, will help you on everything he really loves the subject. Go to class, read and you will get an A.

Everybody says how hot he is but he is not nearly as cute as Dr. Brandon. He is a bit of a tool but a useful tool like a Leatherman. He really knows his stuff so don't get into an argument about the effects of early American religious practices and their effect on the engineering of Stromberg 97s because you WILL lose.
Very good teacher, grades kinda hard. Go to class cause he is a cutie!

Awesome class!!! He is genuinely interested in teaching.  His personality is great/hilarious, and he loves to have open discussions about our readings. It is definitely the best class I have ever taken at OSU. If I missed class I was upset. I looked forward attending it at 9:30 a.m.  And I am not a morning person!!!!! Highly Recommended!!!!
Very interesting class!  Mr. McVicar is a total babe, which keeps you coming to class. Little intimidating on the first day but is a very laid back, did I mention goodlooking? teacher.
Great guy - really interested in subject and in helping students. Totally easy class - Easy A if you show up.

A fantastic instructor! Very interersting, intelligent and energetic. Very willing to help students. Good class discussions. An easy A or B.  Would definitely recommend him to everyone! Pretty cute too!!

tends to be a tool, but great teacher.  always willing to help students with anything.  just make sure to do the readings and go to class, and you should have no problems.  i would suggest anyone take his class
He's a little touchy with attendance and on the first day is a little frightening, but he warms up to the class and then is sooooo easy going.  Great class and great discussions!

He may seem weird at times and may seem like a hardass on the first day of class, but he's really good.  If you do the reading and pay attention in class, this class is easy.  You should have no trouble getting an A or B.
extremely willing to help students,energetic,great discussions...and damn cute.

Lectures are outdated and presented on an overhead projector. Extensive group projects. Was not present the day before the midterm to answer questions. Not helpful at all! Midterm prep includes chapter outlines and vocab lists from a dozen books from the library. Very inconvenient. You basically teach yourself this class. He doesn't do anything.

His class is a waste of time. Take your laptop and get other work done while in class. It's not a hard class but it takes a lot of time to do all the projects. He talks about himself constantly but doesn't return emails and gives too many handouts. Basically the class is just a pain in the ass.

I ended up getting an A- in the class which isn't too bad. His mid terms if awful, it is entirely essay, and listing things you need to memorize everything. Other than that this class involves alot of group work. Our class did so bad on the mid term that or final was take home. Dr. K is very boring and full of himself, thank god it over!!!

After 2 classes I can say I still can't stand this guy. He said our midterm would be over general ideas of the material and then tested us over specific details. If you aren't going into speech the whole class is worthless, especially the portfolios. He has no interest in getting to know students and would rather talk about himself for two hours.

Very boring. He loves to talk about himself and if you flatter him enough and show interest in his life, he will like you. Hes a big shot for the department and you should really get in good with him to further your career. Hard class, but he was head of the national speech and hearing association, so he knows his stuff.
I didn't think he was that bad at all. Concerning his ability to be everything but modest, I have definitely had worst profs then him. I enjoyed lecture, and it was a very easy A.

yes, everything that the other comments have said are true: he's incredibly full of himself. it's hard to handle. BUT! stick in there! it turns out his class is much easier than you originally think. and he truly does know what he's talking about, even if he's a little off of his rocker. i ended up loving it and waking up at 8:30 every day to go.

This professor is absolutly full of himself. I learned more about his family and genuis status and the 7000 places he was the president of than about communication. at least he never changes his exams from year to year, so it's really easy to get an A

He really knows what he's talking about. He is a great teacher, may stray from topics sometimes, but i learned a LOT from this guy. Plus he WANTS everyone to do well in his class and he does everything possible for people to get an A.

Easily the most INFURIATING professor at osu.  I've never met anyone more arrogant or annoying in my life.  He goes out of his way to make students look stupid and he never shuts up about how wonderful he is and how he's soooo smart etc, etc.  There's no avoiding him if you're a shs major, but otherwise AVOID HIS CLASSES

Although he can go off on random tangents about his personal life pertaining to his kids etc. He is very knowledgeable of the field and can be used as a great reference in the field. The assignments and tests are real easy if you just come to class and pay attention.

he loves to hear himself talk and his lectures are ridiculously boring. i think he mentioned his 4.0 GPA that he had all through college at least once or twice a class period. hopefully he'll retire before i ever have to have him again.
I thought he was very knowledgable and informed.  He does ask for busy work, but if you do it, you learn the material.  I recommend him as a connection if you are going to be in the field.
He absolutly LOVES to hear himself talk and his lectures are really boring

makes you do two boring group presentations on standardized tests and then do individual checkouts w/ the ta to show you understand how to give the tests. not hard but just a hassle. lectures are unbearably boring - he constantly talks about himself and how great he is. he should retire and save students the grief of having him as a professor.
No Comments
I have never met someone who loves to talk about himself more than this man. His class is interesting, but there are a LOT of notes and lots of boring lecturing.
It's hard to find a professor at OSU that actually cares about teaching. Such an overall wonderful woman.
Rita is the best! She genuinely cares about her students and wants them to do well in class. She leads great class discussions and works very hard to make sure students understand the material.

She has go to be the nicest professor I have ever had. She is extremely kind, helpful, and passionate about literature. You have to go to class because you have small groups you work in every class. She grades papers pretty easy but her midterm was kind of difficult because I hadn't read half the books.

She tries very hard to make connections with students. I have never had to hesitate about e-mailing her and she has always gotten back to me on time. She grades fairly and always has interesting subject material to read, although sometimes it gets a little overwhelming depending on how fast you can read. No final. One take-home midterm
very kind lady. she gives lots of reading to do, but i barely did any and i still got an a+ in the end. i would take her class again.

This is one of my favorite classes I have ever taken! She is so incredibly kind and friendly and makes learning fun as cheesy as it sounds. Part of it is the class topic but most of it is Trimble. Picked great materials to read, may seem like a lot but there is almost no work for this class. Super easy but very fun. TAKE IT! Or any class she teache

This class is really interesting and Prof Trimble is incredibly clear and helpful! There is a good amount of reading (7 short novels) and work involved. There are 2 response papers, a group presentation and 1 final formal paper. The work load is a little intimidating but if you do the reading and attend class, it's very do-able. LOVED her!
I agree with the first poster. I took this class in au'08 and enjoyed it. Rita made this class interesting. I learned alot. highly recommend for a 2nd writing course.

Great prof, really takes an interest in getting to know the students and is very helpful when you ask her questions. She is happy to give you ideas and help develop them for papers. Her Comparative American Religions class was by far my favorite of the quarter, and class discussions were lively and interesting. Highly recommended.

Prof. is very knowledgeable, but her opinion stands. She will talk down to you if you do not support her opinion. She talks way too much and repeats herself constantly. Projects were very vague. Very  unorganized and knows very little about technology.
Prof. Watson was not a great instructor. Very unapproachable. Talked down to students. Unorganized. No room to disagree with Prof. Watson...her opinion stands!
If you are really shy or don't like talking about yourself, don't take this class. You have to write papers about yourself. Professor is really disorganized and is vague about details of assignments.

This class has a lot of reading. You MUST do it or you will fail. The test and assignments all cover the books she chooses. She talks a lot during "class" discussion. Be careful when expressing your opinion on the topic, she only likes her own and will grade accordingly. Play the game to get the grade. Interesting material, and mandatory attendance

Prof. Watson is very nice, but does need to work on keeping to a schedule and being more organized.  Took a long time to get papers and tests graded.  she is smart and good at her subject but i'm not sure if she should be teaching a 300 level GEC for people who are not as interested in it as her.  overall the content of the class was enjoyable.
I cannot express how much of a HORRIBLE professor this lady is!   She is unorganized and in her own little world.

The course description sounded very interesting and I thought this was going to be my favorite class...not so much.  She is very scatterbrained and it gets really annoying REALLY fast.  Class is too long/boring and most days she keeps you past the bell.
The way she explained concepts were sometimes unclear. Easy grader though. Book not really required to get a good grade. (also, she doesn't post grades on Carmen until the end of the course).

I feel bad for Anastasia.  I think she really wanted us to learn, but no one was interested in the material and she seemed to have a really hard time explaining concepts so that we could understand them.  BUT, she is a nice person and VERY nice grader!! So, the class is hard but as long as you get everything done you will probably end up with an A
I only missed one of her classes...as long as you put in the time for this class you should get a lot out of it!  I really enjoyed her class!
class with this ta has been very unpleasant, does not teach concepts well and expects fluidity in speaking and composition without proper instruction
Horrible professor, head so far up in the air that she doesn't want to listen to anyone with view points that differ from her own racially motivated 'victimization' bull crap.

Worst professor I've had in college.  She wrote the textbooks and were some of the worst I've seen.  Most of her research is from NPR and when asked for supporting research she tells you to google it.  If you see her on the schedule drop the class.

Dr.Jewell is an excellent teacher and really knows what she is talking about. She does do alot of talking during lectures but for me it was always informative and interesting. I learned soooo much from her class!Stay up with the readings, go to class, discuss from time to time and you'll do very well!!

This class was so easy. I didnt use the textbook all quarter. Just go to class and take notes on her long lectures and you will be fine. The only hard thing was trying to stay during the class because she talks so long so early on the morning. Just go to bed early the day before and you will be find. An easy A

nice lady, don't get me wrong, but i would NEVER recommend this class. She rambles on and on the WHOLE time,always off subject, which is bad because then she tests you on it. The books that you have to buy are written by her and HORRIBLE. During lecture, she uses "big" words just to prove she can, but she misuses them a lot(which is actually funny)

She was sooo boring. All she did was talk through the whole hour and 48 minutes. Sometimes she talked about the class, sometimes she didn't. It was so hard to stay awake even if I was fully rested. The material wasn't difficult but there was only 4 grades so if you scrwed up once, that was the end.

The content of the course was very interesting, however, the instructor does not let everyone voice their opinion in regards to the material being discussed.  The readings (which she wrote) were EXTREMELY redundant and not an easy read.  I would recommend the class, but I would NEVER recommend the instructor.
No Comments
This class is so easy if you actually go and take notes, but this is hard because she's monotonous and boring as hell.  She is a veyr understanding and nice woman though.

Great instructor and she really knows her stuff. She gives you plenty of opportunities to do well in her class, however she has an uncanny ability of keeping track of those who pretty much blow off the class. Attend class, participate and the course will become interesting/easier! Vice Versa.
She is a really great teacher.  She is very informative.  If you go to class you will get a good grade.
